sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using iterative methods
message_1:
Suppose we have the following system of equations:
\begin{align*}
3x + y + z &= 7 \\
x - 4y + 2z &= -2 \\
4x + 3y - 5z &= 8
\end{align*}
Using the Jacobi iterative method, solve for the values of $x$, $y$, and $z$. Start with initial guesses of $x_0=1$, $y_0=1$, and $z_0=1$, and iterate until the relative error between consecutive approximations is less than $0.01$.
